thread.title: Ukip donor Arron Banks 'sticks by' comments Hillsborough, saying he's 'sick to death' of hearing about it
thread.title_full: Ukip donor Arron Banks 'sticks by' comments Hillsborough, saying he's 'sick to death' of hearing about it - Mirror Online

author: mirror.co.uk
title: Ukip donor Arron Banks 'sticks by' comments Hillsborough, saying he's 'sick to death' of hearing about it
text:
Ukip donor Arron Banks 'sticks by' comments Hillsborough, saying he's 'sick to death' of hearing about it The millionaire donor said he was "sick to death" of hearing about the 1989 tragedy Share Comments By Mikey Smith 10:32, 22 FEB 2017 Updated 10:37, 22 FEB 2017 News Ukip's biggest donor Arron Banks (Photo: PA) Share Comments Get politics Millionaire Ukip donor Arron Banks says he “sticks by” his comments about the Hillsborough disaster.
Last week the Leave.EU founder, who has given millions to Ukip said he was “sick to death” of hearing about the tragedy.
The comments sparked widespread outrage, with even Ukip leader Paul Nuttall eventually condemning the outburst.
But speaking to 5 Live Daily’s Emma Barnett this morning, he repeated the comments, and said the fury over his comments was a “smear campaign.”
He said: “It's a Labour smear campaign. Yes I am sick to death of hearing about Hillsborough. The politicisation of it by the Labour party is atrocious. I know the people up in Liverpool probably get hot under the collar for those comments, but as far as I'm concerned, I stick by what I said."
Ukip leader Paul Nuttall (Photo: REUTERS) Read More Millionaire Ukip donor complains he's "sick to death" of hearing about Hillsborough He added: “ "Hillsborough was a disaster. It was wrong it was covered up... but for the Labour party to politicise it, was a disgrace."
Nuttall was forced to apologise last week after it was revealed claims made on his website in 2011 and 2012, saying he had lost “close friends” in the 1989 tragedy in Sheffield were untrue.
Nigel Farage with Arron Banks (r) (Photo: Getty) He blamed the falsehoods on his press officer, and insisted he had not read them, despite being repeated twice on his own website and sent out to journalists in a press release.
Read More UKIP chief Paul Nuttall branded a coward after blaming Hillsborough lies on assistant Banks said today: “It had been on his website since 2011. You know what happens in politics. The Labour party goes through whatever anyone's ever said, and then brings it up in the last week of a by-election."
